snippet: Americans who lack medical coverage disapprove of the new health law at roughly the same rate as the insured, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds that Americans who lack medical coverage disapprove of Pres Obama's health care law at roughly same rate as insured; fifty-three percent of uninsured disapprove of law, compared with 51 percent who have health coverage; widespread skepticism underscores political challenge facing Obama administration.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and ALLISON KOPICKI
byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan, Dalia Sussman and Marina Stefan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Americans who lack medical coverage disapprove of the new health law at roughly the same rate as the insured, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.main: Uninsured Skeptical of Health Care Law in Poll
headline.print_headline: Uninsured Skeptical of Health Care Law in Poll

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
